info.headline: Lake Wind Advisory issued February 27 at 10:34AM PST until February 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...LAKE WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST /5 PM MST/ MONDAY... * WHAT...North winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts over 40 mph possible. Waves of 1 to 3 feet. * WHERE...In Arizona, Lake Mohave, Bullhead City and Fort Mohave. In California, San Bernardino County- Upper Colorado River Valley. In Nevada, Lake Mohave to Laughlin. * WHEN...Through 4 PM PST /5 PM MST/ Monday. * IMPACTS...Strong northerly winds and rough waves from Lake Mohave to Davis Dam will create hazardous conditions for boaters. Localized wind gusts could result in some brief power outages, blowing dust, or minor structural damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This advisory is mainly for Lake Mohave including Cottonwood Cove and Katherines Landing, south to the Davis Dam including Laughlin. Farther north, including Lake Mead, is expected to see lesser wind and waves.
info.instruction: Boaters on area lakes should use extra caution since strong winds and rough waves can overturn small craft.
